Package src

Class RegisterValidator

  • java.lang.Object
    • src.RegisterValidator
  • public class RegisterValidator
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to validate the input of the user using regular expressions.
    Author:
    Tam Thai Hoang

    • Field Detail

      • USERNAME_PATTERN

        private static final java.lang.String USERNAME_PATTERN
        USERNAME_PATTERN is a regular expression used to validate the username. Username can only contain letters, numbers, underscores, and hyphens (3-15 chars).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        private static final java.util.regex.Pattern usernamePattern

      • emailPattern

        private static final java.util.regex.Pattern emailPattern

      • NAME_PATTERN

        private static final java.lang.String NAME_PATTERN
        NAME_PATTERN is used to validate the user's display name. Name can be characters from a-z, A-Z, 0-9, _, -, and must be between 0-30 chars.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • namePattern

        private static final java.util.regex.Pattern namePattern

      • PHONE_PATTERN

        private static final java.lang.String PHONE_PATTERN
        PHONE_PATTERN is used to validate the password. Phone number can be empty or contain 8-10 digits.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • phonePattern

        private static final java.util.regex.Pattern phonePattern
